intro: Rhynchospora sola, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense clumps with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a single, slender spike of small, three-ranked flowers. Rhynchospora sola plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
